stream_context.summary: Kaze livestreams level-building work on Course 1, experimenting with a new “bird-house in the clouds” look, tweaking colours, trees and skybox textures, and brainstorming how the player will reach the area (settling on a giant Yoshi’s-Island flower elevator). He also discusses physics tweaks and outlines plans for a public Course 1 demo with a feedback questionnaire.

development_findings.summary: Skybox replaced with Yoshi’s Island artwork and the floating island area is being re-themed into a giant birdhouse to better match that aesthetic.
development_findings.quote: The skybox is so much better than before, and it's now Yoshi's Island related, which is very very good.

development_findings.summary: Interactive flower elevator will replace the current warp pipe; player pulls a bud that grows upward, automatically spinning like an escalator, letting Mario ride leaf platforms to the birdhouse.
development_findings.quote: I think this bud wants to come out… when you try it Mario does the Bowser animation and you have to pull it, then the flower comes out really fast and you can jump from leaf to leaf to get up.

development_findings.summary: Course 1 demo release targeted for ~8 weeks, bundled with a Google-Form questionnaire about new physics and camera settings to collect player data before full game launch.
development_findings.quote: The demo should be coming out in like 8 weeks… I will release this together with a questionnaire—what do you think of the autorotate, the speed at which the pan changes, any bugs you encountered.

development_findings.summary: Sliding physics updated: hard speed cap of 100 removed; speeds above 95 now decay 5 % per frame, preserving momentum when entering slides fast.
development_findings.quote: I soft-capped it at 95, so when you're above 95 you asymptotically approach 95 by like 5 % every frame.

development_findings.summary: 100-coin stars have been scrapped; each course now has six collectible Yoshi coins that can be gathered during any mission without lost progress.
development_findings.quote: There’s no more 100 coin star… It’s replaced by Yoshi coins—you just need to collect six of them.

development_findings.summary: Fast64 now handles functions previously done by hex-editing, allowing HD textures, glove details and lower triangle counts with far less effort.
development_findings.quote: Nowadays we can use Fast 64 which can do all the stuff that I did hex editor without any of the really really difficult parts.

development_findings.summary: HD background textures consume only ~36 KB (16 textures × 0x900 each), well within ROM limits.
development_findings.quote: This is 16 textures and they are all 0x900 each… that’s 36 kilobytes, which is not too much.

development_findings.summary: Graphic fade technique planned for the flower stalk: top segments will gradually reduce alpha and cut out, blending into sky fog.
development_findings.quote: We’ll slowly reduce prim alpha and use cut-out rendering with the shade‐alpha gradient so it disappears into the sky.

development_findings.summary: Kaze prefers NEMU with GDB extension for low-level debugging; RS64 causes crashes and flicker during testing.
development_findings.quote: If I have to debug my code… I use NEMU. RS fucking sucks, dude.

development_findings.summary: Current Blender version’s vertex tools broke expected behaviour, causing modeling slow-downs and frustration.
development_findings.quote: Something is wrong with the edge splitting in this new Blender version… they fucking broke it.

context_findings.summary: Kaze is experiencing mental fatigue and worries about ‘getting stupid’, attributing it to prolonged stress and new-parent sleep loss.
context_findings.quote: Maybe I was just stressed out for so long that my brain functionality is temporarily reduced.

context_findings.summary: He and Zeina recently had their first child (daughter, four weeks old), making scheduling streams and bonus content difficult.
context_findings.quote: If you haven't noticed, I have a small child. That makes planning things really fucking difficult.

context_findings.summary: Goal to upload YouTube videos weekly is now feasible thanks to hiring an editor.
context_findings.quote: That's the awesome part about having an editor—I can make so many videos now.

context_findings.summary: Kaze jokes about revenue expectations, reinforcing that the project is non-commercial.
context_findings.quote: I will send you 0.01 % of the money the game makes off of sales—which is zero.

context_findings.summary: He aims for accessibility: colour-blind friendliness, deaf-friendly cues, and minimal mandatory dialogue.
context_findings.quote: Ideally, this level should be beatable without ever talking to anyone… The game is mostly color-blind friendly.

biobak.summary: Provides real-time art feedback (tree shading, roof beam, coin placement) and aligns on the birdhouse theme.
biobak.quote: Oh are you sure you don't want this Biobak, I think this looks really good now.

key_stories.title: Soft-Cap Sliding Physics
key_stories.summary: Kaze recognised that Mario 64’s hard slide speed cap killed momentum. He re-implemented it with a soft cap so players keep high speed when entering slides fast.
key_stories.challenge: Hard cap at 100 instantly truncated speed.
key_stories.process: Re-coded slide physics so speeds above 95 decay 5 % per frame.
key_stories.outcome: Feels identical in normal cases yet rewards advanced movement.
key_stories.key_quote: When you slide on with a lot of speed, you will keep that speed, which feels good I think.

key_stories.title: Flower Elevator Pivot
key_stories.summary: The warp pipe entrance felt thematically wrong. After chat brainstorming, Kaze decided on a giant Yoshi’s-Island flower bud that players pull to grow an auto-spinning stalk, replacing the pipe and enhancing discovery.
key_stories.challenge: Need a thematically consistent, intuitive way to reach high birdhouse area.
key_stories.process: Discarded pipe and vine ideas, sketched animated bud + bunny hint, designed leaf spacing and fade-to-fog rendering.
key_stories.outcome: Implementation plan drafted; model and code will be built off-stream.
key_stories.key_quote: You can grab it Bowser-style and pull; the flower shoots up and you ride the leaves.

key_stories.title: Course 1 Demo & Feedback Loop
key_stories.summary: Kaze wants concrete data on new physics and camera. He schedules a Course 1 demo for public release within two months, bundled with a Google-Form questionnaire.
key_stories.challenge: Unsure if players will enjoy revamped controls and camera.
key_stories.process: Map out video schedule, draft questions (will use ChatGPT then ‘actual human’ to edit).
key_stories.outcome: Internal deadline set; community will influence final tuning.
key_stories.key_quote: I want more data on gameplay… so that when I release the full game, we know for sure people like the camera and the physics.

open_questions.topic: Final design and usability of the flower elevator
open_questions.context: Concept decided but exact leaf spacing, input method and visual hints are still speculative.
